text: Robert Warley Wilson (born 15 July 1934) is a former first-class cricketer who played for Oxford University in 1956 and 1957. Robert Wilson was educated at Warwick School before going up to Brasenose College, Oxford.Wisden 1958, p. 291. An off-spin bowler, he played one match in 1956 and a full season in 1957. His best first-class figures were 4 for 42 against D. R. Jardine’s XI in 1957. After graduating from Oxford he went to Canada, where he played several matches of non-first-class cricket for the national team. ==References== ==External links== * * Robert Wilson at CricketArchive Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:People educated at Warwick School Category:Alumni of Brasenose College, Oxford Category:English cricketers Category:Oxford University cricketers Category:Free Foresters cricketers
title: Robert Wilson (cricketer, born 1934)
